column5: last fall i was lucky enuf to get a used riptide 101 lbs trolling motor.....after i was unlucky enuf to destroy my 70 lbs thrust on simcoeanyways took it out a few times and wow talk bout power aile goby and i were crusing out on boq we hit 6 mph..in the wind.....well this year i saw the new gps add on for these trolling motors they look pretty cool to have....cost is round 450.00http://www.minnkotamotors.com/company/pres...rol_system.aspxwas wondering if anyone has one or has used one of these.....cheers pete

A good friend of mine has been using one this winter on the Niagara and loves it. It has some great capabilities like co-pilot, auto plilot and most importantly spot lock and a route memory. you can record 2 trails up to 2 miles long and it will follow the GPS trail at whatever speed you want. The spot lock feature will hold you stationary (on a waypoint or rock pile per say) within 5 feet and you never have to touch your motor. Even if the wind increases, the motor will compensate.  The only thing is that if you put the iPilot on, there is no pedal for the unit after that, everything is controlled by the remote.. course, speed, on and off etc.  JP
